options.option_text: The body/payload in an HTTP request is mandatory
The “Content-Length” header indicates the size of the request body in bytes
User diagnosis and recovery from errors

questions.question_text_1: A mobile client starts from and is cruising away continuously at 60 kmph from the network tower whose network range is 40 km and bandwidth is 120 Mbps. How much data (in Gigabytes) will be consumed by the client who is continuously using the entire bandwidth before completely moving out of the network?  [Take 1 Byte = 8 bits, 1 KB = 1000 Bytes, 1 MB = 1000 Kilobytes and so on.]  [Consider the speed of light in air to be 3 x 108 m/sec.]
question_texts: A mobile client starts from and is cruising away continuously at 60 kmph from the network tower whose network range is 40 km and bandwidth is 120 Mbps. questions.question_text_1: What is the correct sequence of working of Client-Server Architecture.  a. The client asks for the IP address for the particular server from the Domain Name system. b. To that IP address, the client sends the request to the particular server with that port number that is specified to the particular application and then server responds c. The DNS server responds with the IP address. d. The response message is received by the client and based on that port number, the response packet is consumed by the application to which it belongs.

The DNS server responds with the IP address. d. The response message is received by the client and based on that port number, the response packet is consumed by the application to which it belongs.

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### 1. **HTTP Protocol**
- **Concepts**: HTTP headers, request body, Content-Type, Content-Length.
- **Principles**: HTTP headers are case-insensitive, the request body is not mandatory, Content-Length indicates the size of the request body in bytes.

#### 2. **Matrices and Determinants**
- **Concepts**: Square matrix, Least Significant Bits (LSB), determinant of a matrix.
- **Equations**:
  \[
  \text{Determinant of a 3x3 matrix } A = \begin{vmatrix}
  a & b & c \\
  d & e & f \\
  g & h & i
  \end{vmatrix} = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)
  \]

#### 3. **Usability Heuristic Principles**
- **Concepts**: Error prevention, visibility of system status, user control and freedom, flexibility and ease of use, aesthetic and minimalist design.
- **Principles**: Error messages should clearly indicate what went wrong and how to fix it.

#### 4. **URL Components**
- **Concepts**: Protocol, domain, sub-domain, path.
- **Principles**: Understanding the structure of URLs and their components.

#### 5. **Character Encoding and Disk Size**
- **Concepts**: Character set, fixed encoding, disk size, bits, bytes, kilobytes, megabytes.
- **Equations**:
  \[
  \text{Number of characters} = \frac{\text{Disk size in bytes}}{\text{Number of bits per character} / 8}
  \]

#### 6. **Network Range and Bandwidth**
- **Concepts**: Network range, bandwidth, data consumption, speed of light.
- **Equations**:
  \[
  \text{Time to move out of network range} = \frac{\text{Network range}}{\text{Speed}}
  \]
  \[
  \text{Data consumed} = \text{Bandwidth} \times \text{Time}
  \]

#### 7. **Python String Template**
- **Concepts**: String substitution, Template class, placeholders.
- **Principles**: Using the `string.Template` class to perform string substitution in Python.

#### 8. **CSS Specificity**
- **Concepts**: Element selector, ID selector, class selector, specificity.
- **Principles**: ID selectors have higher specificity than class selectors, which have higher specificity than element selectors.

#### 9. **Client-Server Architecture**
- **Concepts**: IP address, Domain Name System (DNS), port number, response message.
- **Principles**: The sequence of steps in client-server communication.

#### 10. **HTML and CSS Rendering**
- **Concepts**: HTML elements, CSS styles, specificity, rendering.
- **Principles**: How browsers apply styles based on the specificity of selectors.

#### 11. **Jinja2 Templating Engine**
- **Concepts**: Template rendering, variable substitution, grouping.
- **Principles**: Using Jinja2 to render templates with dynamic content.

#### 12. **Flask Application**
- **Concepts**: Flask, static URL path, static folder, command-line arguments.
- **Principles**: Configuring and running a Flask application with different static URL paths and folders.

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[HTTP Protocol] --> B[HTTP Headers]
    A --> C[Request Body]
    A --> D[Content-Type]
    A --> E[Content-Length]

    F[Matrices and Determinants] --> G[Square Matrix]
    F --> H[Least Significant Bits]
    F --> I[Determinant]

    J[Usability Heuristic Principles] --> K[Error Prevention]
    J --> L[Visibility of System Status]
    J --> M[User Control and Freedom]
    J --> N[Flexibility and Ease of Use]
    J --> O[Aesthetic and Minimalist Design]

    P[URL Components] --> Q[Protocol]
    P --> R[Domain]
    P --> S[Sub-Domain]
    P --> T[Path]

    U[Character Encoding and Disk Size] --> V[Character Set]
    U --> W[Fixed Encoding]
    U --> X[Disk Size]

    Y[Network Range and Bandwidth] --> Z[Network Range]
    Y --> AA[Bandwidth]
    Y --> AB[Data Consumption]

    AC[Python String Template] --> AD[String Substitution]
    AC --> AE[Template Class]
    AC --> AF[Placeholders]

    AG[CSS Specificity] --> AH[Element Selector]
    AG --> AI[ID Selector]
    AG --> AJ[Class Selector]

    AK[Client-Server Architecture] --> AL[IP Address]
    AK --> AM[Domain Name System]
    AK --> AN[Port Number]
    AK --> AO[Response Message]

    AP[HTML and CSS Rendering] --> AQ[HTML Elements]
    AP --> AR[CSS Styles]
    AP --> AS[Specificity]
    AP --> AT[Rendering]

    AU[Jinja2 Templating Engine] --> AV[Template Rendering]
    AU --> AW[Variable Substitution]
    AU --> AX[Grouping]

    AY[Flask Application] --> AZ[Flask]
    AY --> BA[Static URL Path]
    AY --> BB[Static Folder]
    AY --> BC[Command-Line Arguments]
```

This knowledge graph visually maps the relationships between the core topics, concepts, principles, and equations essential for the exam.
